answers.answer: Hi ready2Bdone. Nice to see you post ! :) You have done a very good job with your taper Congrats !! I do not think I will be breaking the rules to say it would be good to start putting more time between dosages.. get some Imodium on board and make sure you are drinking a lot of fluids a sports drink would be good Help to replace electrolytes. sorry to read of your diabetes being clean thou will give you a better opportunity to deal with it. my bp went down a lil when I got clean and my life became so much more enjoyable.. Keep yourself occupied and make a quit date on your calender.. Keep a positive attitude and a I can do spirit. You and your children deserve so much more the the haze of addiction.. lesa

ty lesa! my bp actually went down to probably due to all the diarhhea and the metformin for diabetes gives me diarrhea too. but i ended up losing 30 pounds, not the best way but hey.im eating better now and drinking tea and more water. all i was drinking before was cokes all day long. and my diet sucked before i found out i was diabetic. just got a call from my dr office and my a1c test for diabetes was a 6.1 which is very good considering i was at an 11 3 months ago (very bad)  but was just informed i also have high cholesterol and being put on another med..ugh  but i will def start the sports drinks. not sure how many i can have being a diabetic but will do lots of water too. its an hour past the time i should have one. guess ill wait and see how long i can go before i need another dose. ty for your help
oopps forgot to congrat you on being clean!! thats awesome and i can not wait till i can say that!

Hell of a way to loose weight !! You sound like you have a positive attitude about the whole thing. this is good :) They have sports drinks that have less sugar look for these but definitely push the water.. no soda :( I love Dr. Pepper so I know how difficult that can be. I started a garden last year and have one this year. I have liver and kidney disease so it became important to me to eat healthier my garden also occupies time and this is always a good thing ! You have done good on bringing down your diabetic reading !! Keep up the good work :) try to keep the time between dosing the same Like if you go 6 hours wait another six until you no longer feel wd then make it longer.. repeat till you are down to 1 then go for it !! The lack of sleep will effect you most I suspect as it is essential but it does not last forever.. Thank you for the Congrats ! :) I can not wait till you are on this side either :))

Hey!  Just saw your post :)  You can do this!  Keep your head up okay, and stay positive :)  Have you seen the Thomas Recipe and Amino Acids Protocol links yet?  If not here they are:http://www.medhelp.org/health_pages/Addiction/Thomas-Recipe-Re-Posted/show/16?cid=66http://www.medhelp.org/health_pages/Addiction/Amino-Acid-Protocol/show/15?cid=66You can find other links to different pages on the bottom right column.  Some of the things in there might help you through this though.  STAY HYDRATED!!!!  Drink water even if you have to FORCE it down.  Try to drink an ounce every 15 mins if you can't keep anything down.  That seems to have helped many.  Also try juices and gatorades and stuff that will replenish other lost vitamins and minerals and electrolytes, etc etc.  You can get through this.  It might be hard for a while but you are finally going to get YOU back and you deserve that, so do your babies :)  (as I know you still see them like that! )Gnarly always says that it's 1/3 physical and 2/3 mental.  You'll go through the physical first mostly, but the mental part will come too, stay strong and keep your head up :) And always smile :)

running out the door but wanted to post a quick update (whew can u tell it doesn't take much to get me excited) going on hour 7 with no dose! just a little worried about getting out in public (stomach already starting to sound like a wild animal) lol  but ill keep a half on me just in case. getting out helps from watching the clock too. when i get back ill reply to your encouraging posts :)
So sorry I haven't posted sooner :)  Been working !  Anyway, it sounds like you are doing fairly well :)  How are you feeling today???

hi!  quick update. down to 3 x a day. its sooo hard. the mental part is really starting to get me. weird as it seems even though i had originally been taking 4-5 at a time when i cut down to 1 at a time i started getting a high from it again within a few days. very short and mild one but it was still there. i dont get that with only taking a half so yeah its hard. lol BUT i took one at 9 this morning and did not take my next one until 6!  no diarrhea or w/d like i had been experiencing taking them every 4 hours. idk if its a fluke but time will tell. :)  ah and i figured out the computer is a trigger for me...anywho thanks for checking on me. will keep you updated

that suc ks that the computer is a trigger.  We'll understand then if you don't post very much :)  Keep your head up, hopefully you'll get out of it lucky and not have to deal with the nasty symptoms haha Doing great keep going :)

yes it does, but i still find myself coming back the comp. lol  well i fell back this morning :/  at 10 i took a whole one. but here it is almost 6 and except for the mental cravings i am doing ok. its such a huge relief not dealing with mini w/d every 4 hours! i honestly think getting the diabetes was my life saver. i am way more active and trying to live a healthier lifestyle. just wish i would of been strong enough to do it without the dx. i realize my taper has been long and drawn out, but i think its helping me to deal with it....going to check on supper. have a good night!
ah so it beat me again....7:15 gave in and  took a half. but i refuse to let it get me down.  9 1/2 hours is quite the accomplishment for me :)

Glad that you're not letting it get you down.  I think that as long as you continue to lengthen the time between and try your hardest not to take them at ALL you'll be doing okay.  Just ride it out as long as you can.  And yes, 9 1/2 hours is a long time!!! :)

question: trying to get all the support i can. i have been using off and on for several years due to a dew surgeries. at first it started out here and there. i could do with or without them though i loved taking them. few years down the road i wasnt even taking that many and  one night didnt have any at all and woke up tossing and turning along with diarrhea. took me awhile to figure out what was wrong but once i did i popped a lorcet and all was better. happened again a bit later. had no idea how addicting these things were. i started out with vicodin 5mg and at my worst lorcet 10mg 15-20 a day. enough was enough. i was always chasing that high and very rarely achieving it. over the last few months i have started tapering down in attempt to quit. did the taper method since having a few mild wd and then finding these boards and realizing they get much worse. scared me to death. i have several other health problems. depression, high blood pressure and recently dx diabetes. i have 2 eleven year olds and they need their mom. the past 2 weeks i have taken 4 10mg a day. and yesterday i went to 3 mg. 1 in the morning 1/2 a pill 4 hours later then another 1/2 4 hours after that 1 more pill before bed. the thing is i was always taking them every 4 hours. so anytime i try to go more than 4 hours my stomach starts making these horrible noises, blurred vision and then the diarrhea starts. 2 months ago i did this (was taking 8 pills a day) and was up to taking them every every 7 hours instead of 4. i had so much watery diarrhea ( to the point i couldnt even hold it) i ended up in the er severely dehydrated very low potassium. diarrhea vomiting and my 19 year old had to help me walk in the er. so needless to say i am scared to death! btw the er visit was when i found out i was a diabetic so at least something good came out of it i guess. anywho sorry to be so long winded. im just trying to do this as carefully as possible. in between drs so i cant go to them for help. i plan on staying at 3 a day for a few days and instead of every 4 hours try to go to every 5 hours. any help at all would be greatly appreciated because now that im down so low im not sure how to go to the next step.
